comment.author: 82214664@N00
comment._content: Can somebody explain why this is part of the National Archives?

comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content: Hi Mark in NOVA, In the 1970s, the Environmental Protection Agency commissioned freelance photographers to take photos of the environment, EPA activities, and general life in the United States. This project, called Documerica, took place from 1971-1977, and because they were records of the EPA, the National Archives now has these photos. You can see more interesting Documerica photos in our collection, or if you are particularly inspired, participate in the EPA's current photo project, State of the Environment! Mary U.S. National Archives

comment.author: 82214664@N00
comment._content:
Thanks. 

It's too bad it wasn't shot using Kodachrome film. The color had deteriorated quite a bit.
